Weapon Attack.description: You are embarassed by your poor showing, but nothing remarkable happens.
Weapon Attack.lore: Bards sing mournfully of Duelmaster Jorra's attempt to shouted the wrong incantation at a critical moment.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your combat footing, exposing yourself to your target.
Weapon Attack.effect: Your target has advantage on their first attack roll against you next round.
Weapon Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Sir Galwyn, who famously fell into a decorative fountain while charging.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your combat footing, exposing yourself to your enemies.
Weapon Attack.effect: Your enemies have advantage on their first attack roll against you next round.
Weapon Attack.lore: The archives of Thalem record a similar blunder during the Great Summit.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your combat footing, and have difficulty recovering.
Weapon Attack.effect: Your enemies have advantage on their attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
Weapon Attack.lore: It is said that during the the Battle of Shifting Sands, Lady Myri tripped over their own weapon.

Weapon Attack.description: Melee: You get tangled with your enemy and fall over. Ranged: You spill your quiver.
Weapon Attack.effect: Melee: You are knocked prone and your movement is reduced to 0. Your target must succeed a DC 10 dexterity check or they are also knocked prone. Ranged: You must pick up arrows individually from the ground using your “environmental interaction”, or the “Use an Object” action to nock your bow.
Weapon Attack.lore: The archives of Stormwatch Keep record a similar blunder during the Great Summit.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your balance while attacking.
Weapon Attack.effect: You fall prone and your movement is reduced to 0.
Weapon Attack.lore: The archives of The Mistlands record a similar blunder during the Siege of Broken Hill.

Weapon Attack.description: As you attack your opponent you begin to fear that they are the superior combatant.
Weapon Attack.effect: Disadvantage on your next attack roll against your target.
Weapon Attack.lore: The archives of The Mistlands record a similar blunder during the Siege of Broken Hill.

Weapon Attack.description: You miss an attack and gaze upon the chaos of the battle, causing your confidence to falter.
Weapon Attack.effect: Disadvantage on your next attack roll against any target.
Weapon Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Sir Galwyn, who famously summoned a chicken instead of a fireball.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your grip as you attack.
Weapon Attack.effect: Roll a DC 10 Dexterity Check, on failure you drop your weapon at your feet.
Weapon Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Apprentice Threx, who famously shouted the wrong incantation at a critical moment.

Weapon Attack.description: Melee: The weapon slips from your hand as you attack. Ranged: Your ammunition gets lodged in its container.
Weapon Attack.effect: Melee: Roll a DC 10 Dexterity Check, on failure you throw your weapon into your enemy’s space. DM determines where the item is thrown on large sized or greater creatures. Ranged: You must use an action to organize the ammunition in its case before you can make another ranged attack.
Weapon Attack.lore: The archives of Stormwatch Keep record a similar blunder during the Festival of Lights.

Weapon Attack.description: Melee: You lunge past an enemy exposing yourself to his attack. Ranged: Your missile startles your allies near your target.
Weapon Attack.effect: Melee: Enemy you were attacking is able to use their reaction to perform and attack of opportunity. Ranged: the target can perform an opportunity attack on any ally within melee range.
Weapon Attack.lore: Legends from Silverdeep speak of the day a hero lost their footing before a duel.

Weapon Attack.description: Missing what you thought was a critical blow causes you to panic.
Weapon Attack.effect: End your current turn and you are surprised until the end of your next turn.
Weapon Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Arcanist Vorn, who famously tripped over their own weapon.

Weapon Attack.description: You attack wildly and lose track of the fight around you.
Weapon Attack.effect: End your turn and move to the bottom of the initiative order at the start of the next round.
Weapon Attack.lore: It is said that during the the Siege of Broken Hill, Velruun lost their footing before a duel.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your footing while attacking and fall to the ground bumping your head.
Weapon Attack.effect: You fall prone. Roll a DC 10 constitution save, on failure you take 1d6 damage and are knocked unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source. On success take half damage and you remain conscious.
Weapon Attack.lore: It is said that during the the Siege of Broken Hill, Duelmaster Jorra froze mid-spell, overcome by sneezing.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your footing while attacking and fall head first.
Weapon Attack.effect: You fall prone. Roll a DC 15 constitution save, on failure you take 2d6 damage and are knocked unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source. On success take half damage and you remain conscious.
Weapon Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Duelmaster Jorra, who famously tripped over their own weapon.

Weapon Attack.description: You lose your footing while attacking and slam your head into the ground.
Weapon Attack.effect: You fall prone, take 3d6 damage, and become unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source.
Weapon Attack.lore: Even the great Velruun once shouted the wrong incantation at a critical moment.

Spell Attack.description: You are embarassed by your poor showing, but nothing remarkable happens.
Spell Attack.lore: Velruun's misfortune in trying to fell into a decorative fountain while charging is still joked about today.

Spell Attack.description: You get wrapped up in your spellcasting and forget to watch your target.
Spell Attack.effect: Your target has advantage on their first attack roll against you next round.
Spell Attack.lore: Tales of Seer Halmin warn against lost their footing before a duel.

Spell Attack.description: You get wrapped up in your spellcasting and forget to watch your surroundings.
Spell Attack.effect: All enemies have advantage on their first attack roll against you next round.
Spell Attack.lore: Even the great Apprentice Threx once lost their footing before a duel.

Spell Attack.description: You are so wrapped up in your spellcasting that you forget you are fighting a battle.
Spell Attack.effect: All enemies have advantage on their attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of Silverdeep record a similar blunder during the Festival of Lights.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell creates a large plume of smoke obscuring your location.
Spell Attack.effect: The area in a 5 foot radius around your location becomes heavily obscured for 1 minute. A strong breeze can blow away the smoke in 1 round.
Spell Attack.lore: Legends from Stormwatch Keep speak of the day a hero fell into a decorative fountain while charging.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell misfires knocking you over.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of Silverdeep record a similar blunder during the Battle of Shifting Sands.

Spell Attack.description: The spell fires in an unexpected manner, causing your confidence in your abilities to falter.
Spell Attack.effect: You have disadvantage on any spell attacks, and enemies have advantage against your spell savings throws until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of The Mistlands record a similar blunder during the Festival of Lights.

Spell Attack.description: The placement of your spell startles your allies near your target, causing them to drop their guard.
Spell Attack.effect: Your target is able to use their reaction to take an attack of opportunity on one of your allies in melee range.
Spell Attack.lore: Bards sing mournfully of Apprentice Threx's attempt to fell into a decorative fountain while charging.

Spell Attack.description: You scramble the ingredients of your component pouch or your focus becomes overloaded with magical energy and temporarily stops working.
Spell Attack.effect: You are unable to perform material components to cast spells until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: Seer Halmin's misfortune in trying to accidentally cast a spell on themselves is still joked about today.

Spell Attack.description: Your arm cramps as you cast.
Spell Attack.effect: You are unable to perform somatic components to cast spells until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: Bards sing mournfully of Sir Galwyn's attempt to shouted the wrong incantation at a critical moment.

Spell Attack.description: You bite your tongue as you cast.
Spell Attack.effect: You are unable to use verbal components to cast spells until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Sir Galwyn, who famously froze mid-spell, overcome by sneezing.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell misfires and dazes you, causing you to lose track of the fight.
Spell Attack.effect: End your turn and move to the bottom of the initiative order at the start of the next round.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of Ashvale record a similar blunder during the Great Summit.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell misfires causing you to panic.
Spell Attack.effect: End your current turn and you are surprised until the end of your next turn.
Spell Attack.lore: Legends from Bar Grunnd speak of the day a hero fell into a decorative fountain while charging.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell backfires creating a small explosion causing you to fall and bump your head.
Spell Attack.effect: You fall prone. Roll a DC 10 constitution save, on failure you take 1d6 bludeoning damage and are knocked unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source. On success take half damage and you remain conscious.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of Bar Grunnd record a similar blunder during the Siege of Broken Hill.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell backfires creating a large explosion causing you to fall and bump your head.
Spell Attack.effect: You fall prone. Roll a DC 15 constitution save, on failure you take 1d6 bludgeoning damage, 1d6 thunder damage, and are knocked unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source. On success take half damage and you remain conscious.
Spell Attack.lore: Historians still tell the story of Apprentice Threx, who famously shouted the wrong incantation at a critical moment.

Spell Attack.description: Your spell completely backfires creating a large explosion causing you to fall and bump your head.
Spell Attack.effect: You hit yourself with your spell. If the spell effect is instant you take the full effect. If the spell requires concentration the effect persists until the end of your next turn. You also fall prone, take 1d6 bludgeoning damage, 1d6 thunder damage, and become unconscious for 1 minute or until you receive damage from any source.
Spell Attack.lore: The archives of Stormwatch Keep record a similar blunder during the Great Summit.
